title: Shopping & Money
description: Learn vocabulary for shopping, paying, and handling money.

words.example: What is the price of this jacket?
Can I have the receipt, please?
The fitting room is over there.
Can I exchange this for a larger size?
words.exampleMeaning: 더 큰 사이즈로 교환할 수 있나요?

words.example: I'd like to return this shirt.
Let's go to the department store.
I left my wallet at home.
Put it in the shopping cart.
Go to checkout when you're ready.

words.koreanCommonMistake: return과 혼동 - return은 반품, refund는 환불
expensive와 혼동 - expense는 명사, expensive는 형용사

words.example: I put money in my savings account.
words.koreanCommonMistake: 단수 saving이 아닌 복수 savings 사용

words.mnemonic: pur(위해) + chase(쫓다) = 원하는 것을 쫓아가서 사다

words.example: It comes with a one-year warranty.

words.mnemonic: total = 토(土) + tal = 모든 것을 더한 총합

words.example: I need some coins for parking.
words.mnemonic: coin = 코(co) + in = 안에 넣는 둥근 돈

words.exampleMeaning: 이 20달러 지폐를 잔돈으로 바꿀 수 있나요?

words.example: I prefer to use my debit card.
words.koreanCommonMistake: credit card와 차이 - debit은 즉시 출금
words.mnemonic: debit(빚) + card = 빚 안 지는 카드
store = 저장(store)하는 곳 = 물건을 파는 곳

words.koreanCommonMistake: 동사와 명사 둘 다 사용 가능

words.example: I want to buy a new phone.
words.mnemonic: buy = 바이바이 하면서 돈 주고 사다

words.example: I spend too much on clothes.
Check the price tag before buying.
This item is out of stock.
words.mnemonic: item = 아이(I)가 템(tem)포 빠르게 사는 물건

words.example: Everything is 50% off in the clearance section.
words.exampleMeaning: 재고 정리 구역에서 모든 것이 50% 할인입니다.

exercises.question: What do you get after paying?
exercises.explanation: A receipt is the paper you get after paying.

exercises.question: What is the opposite of 'expensive'?
exercises.explanation: 'Cheap' means low price, opposite of 'expensive'.

exercises.question: Can I pay by _____ card? (credit)
exercises.explanation: A credit card is used for electronic payment.

exercises.question: I'd like to _____ this on. (try)
exercises.explanation: 'Try on' means to wear something to see if it fits.

exercises.question: Where do you go to try clothes?
exercises.explanation: A fitting room is where you try on clothes.

exercises.question: What do you call money you get back?
exercises.explanation: 'Change' is the money returned after paying.

exercises.question: This is too _____. I can't afford it. (expensive)
exercises.explanation: 'Expensive' means high price.

exercises.question: Match English with Korean:
exercises.explanation: Match shopping terms with Korean meanings.

exercises.question: What is '20% off' called?
exercises.explanation: 'Discount' means a reduction in price.

exercises.question: The _____ is always right. (customer)
exercises.explanation: A famous saying: The customer is always right.

exercises.question: Where do you pay in a store?
exercises.explanation: The checkout is where you pay for items.

exercises.question: I left my _____ at home. (wallet)
exercises.explanation: A wallet is where you keep money and cards.

exercises.question: What's another word for a good deal?
exercises.explanation: A bargain is something sold at a good price.

exercises.question: What _____ do you need? Small or medium? (size)
exercises.explanation: 'Size' refers to how big or small something is.

exercises.question: What can't you do with cash at online shops?
exercises.explanation: Online shops usually don't accept physical cash.

exercises.question: What do you call money back after a return?
exercises.explanation: A refund is money returned after returning a product.

exercises.question: What helps you manage your money?
exercises.explanation: A budget is a plan for spending and saving money.

exercises.question: What is another word for 'cost'?
exercises.explanation: Expense means the cost or money spent on something.

exercises.question: What do you call money put aside for the future?
exercises.explanation: Savings is money kept for future use.

exercises.question: Who takes your money at the checkout?
exercises.explanation: A cashier is the person who processes payments.

exercises.question: What determines how good something is?
exercises.explanation: Quality refers to how good or bad something is.

exercises.question: What guarantees a product will work?
exercises.explanation: A warranty is a guarantee that a product will work properly.

exercises.question: What is round metal money called?
exercises.explanation: A coin is round metal money.

exercises.question: What card takes money directly from your bank?
exercises.explanation: A debit card withdraws money directly from your bank account.

exercises.question: What brings items to your home?
exercises.explanation: Delivery is the service of bringing items to your home.

exercises.question: What type of sale clears old stock?
exercises.explanation: Clearance sales are used to sell old or excess stock.

exercises.question: What shows the price on an item?
exercises.explanation: A price tag displays the cost of an item.

exercises.question: What is another word for 'item'?
exercises.explanation: Product and item both refer to things for sale.

exercises.question: What is the general word for currency?
exercises.explanation: Money is the general term for all forms of currency.

exercises.question: I need a _____ if I want to return this. (refund)
exercises.explanation: You need a refund to get your money back.

exercises.question: I'm on a tight _____ this month. (budget)
exercises.explanation: A tight budget means limited money to spend.

exercises.question: Travel _____ are very high. (expenses)
exercises.explanation: Expenses are costs or money spent.

exercises.question: I keep my money in my _____ account. (savings)
exercises.explanation: A savings account is for storing money.

exercises.question: Keep your _____ receipt for warranty. (purchase)
exercises.explanation: A purchase receipt proves you bought something.

exercises.question: The _____ will help you at checkout. (cashier)
exercises.explanation: The cashier processes your payment.

exercises.question: This product has excellent _____. (quality)
exercises.explanation: Quality refers to how good something is.

exercises.question: It comes with a one-year _____. (warranty)
exercises.explanation: A warranty guarantees the product.

exercises.question: What is the _____ of this dress? (cost)
exercises.explanation: Cost means the price of something.

exercises.question: What _____ method do you prefer? (payment)
exercises.explanation: Payment method refers to how you pay.

exercises.question: The _____ is $100 including tax. (total)
exercises.explanation: Total is the complete sum of all costs.

exercises.question: Sales _____ is 10% in this state. (tax)
exercises.explanation: Tax is money paid to the government.

exercises.question: I need some _____ for the parking meter. (coins)
exercises.explanation: Coins are needed for many parking meters.

exercises.question: Can you break this $50 _____? (bill)
exercises.explanation: Bill refers to paper money.

exercises.question: I prefer using my _____ card. (debit)
exercises.explanation: A debit card directly accesses your bank account.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 환불 받을 수 있나요?
exercises.explanation: Asking for a refund politely.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 예산이 빠듯합니다.
exercises.explanation: Expressing limited financial resources.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 지출을 줄여야 합니다.
answer: I need to reduce my expenses.
exercises.explanation: Talking about reducing costs.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 저축 계좌를 열었습니다.
exercises.explanation: Stating you opened a savings account.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 이 구매를 후회합니다.
exercises.explanation: Expressing regret about buying something.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 계산원에게 물어보세요.
exercises.explanation: Directing someone to ask the cashier.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 품질이 좋습니다.
exercises.explanation: Describing good quality.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 보증 기간이 얼마나 됩니까?
exercises.explanation: Asking about warranty duration.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 비용이 얼마입니까?
exercises.explanation: Asking about the price.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 결제 방법이 무엇입니까?
answer: What payment method do you use?
exercises.explanation: Asking about how someone pays.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 합계가 얼마입니까?
exercises.explanation: Asking for the total amount.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 세금이 포함되어 있나요?
exercises.explanation: Asking if tax is part of the price.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 동전이 필요합니다.
exercises.explanation: Stating need for coins.

exercises.question: Translate to English: 계산서를 주세요.
exercises.explanation: Requesting the bill.

exercises.question: Translate to Korean: I prefer shopping online.
exercises.explanation: Expressing preference for online shopping.

exercises.question: Translate to Korean: The store is having a clearance sale.
exercises.explanation: Describing a clearance sale.

exercises.question: Translate to Korean: Check the price tag.
exercises.explanation: Instructing to check the price tag.

exercises.question: Translate to Korean: This item is out of stock.
exercises.explanation: Stating something is sold out.

exercises.question: Translate to Korean: We only sell quality products.
exercises.explanation: Emphasizing product quality.

exercises.question: Translate to Korean: I don't have enough money.
exercises.explanation: Expressing lack of money.

exercises.question: Translate to Korean: Free delivery on all orders.
exercises.explanation: Advertising free delivery.

exercises.question: Translate to Korean: Do you accept credit cards?
exercises.explanation: Asking if credit cards are accepted.

exercises.question: Translate to Korean: I need to save money.
exercises.explanation: Expressing need to save money.

exercises.question: Translate to Korean: Can I pay by debit card?
exercises.explanation: Asking about debit card payment.

exercises.question: Translate to Korean: I want to buy a new laptop.
exercises.explanation: Expressing desire to purchase.

exercises.question: Translate to Korean: They sell everything at low prices.
exercises.explanation: Describing low-price sales.

exercises.question: Translate to Korean: Don't spend all your money.
exercises.explanation: Advising not to spend everything.

exercises.question: A refund means you get your money back.
exercises.explanation: True. A refund is when you receive your money back after returning something.

exercises.question: A budget helps you spend more money.
exercises.explanation: False. A budget helps you manage and control spending, not spend more.

exercises.question: Expenses are money you spend.
exercises.explanation: True. Expenses refer to costs or money spent on things.

exercises.question: Savings means spending all your money.
exercises.explanation: False. Savings is money you keep, not spend.

exercises.question: A cashier works at the checkout.
exercises.explanation: True. Cashiers process payments at checkout counters.

exercises.question: High quality means something is bad.
exercises.explanation: False. High quality means something is good or excellent.

exercises.question: A warranty guarantees a product.
exercises.explanation: True. A warranty is a guarantee that a product will work properly.

exercises.question: Cost and price mean the same thing.
exercises.explanation: True. Cost and price both refer to how much something costs.

exercises.question: Tax is optional when shopping.
exercises.explanation: False. Tax is usually mandatory and added to purchases.

exercises.question: Coins and bills are both forms of money.
exercises.explanation: True. Coins are metal money and bills are paper money.

exercises.question: A debit card and credit card are exactly the same.
exercises.explanation: False. Debit cards use your bank money; credit cards borrow money.

exercises.question: Delivery brings items to your home.
exercises.explanation: True. Delivery service transports items to your location.

exercises.question: Clearance sales have higher prices.
exercises.explanation: False. Clearance sales offer discounted prices to clear inventory.

exercises.question: Buy and purchase mean the same thing.
exercises.explanation: True. Both words mean to acquire something by paying.

exercises.question: Match the words with their meanings:
exercises.explanation: Matching shopping vocabulary with Korean meanings.

exercises.question: Match payment types:
exercises.explanation: Matching payment methods with Korean.

exercises.question: Match verbs with meanings:
exercises.explanation: Matching shopping verbs.

exercises.question: Match shopping terms:
exercises.explanation: Matching common shopping words.

exercises.question: Match money terms:
exercises.explanation: Matching money-related vocabulary.

exercises.question: Match opposites:
exercises.explanation: Matching antonyms in shopping context.

exercises.question: Match places with activities:
exercises.explanation: Matching locations with shopping activities.

exercises.question: Match shopping documents:
exercises.explanation: Matching shopping documents.

exercises.question: Match sale types:
exercises.explanation: Matching different types of sales.

exercises.question: Match with synonyms:
exercises.explanation: Matching words with similar meanings.

exercises.question: Match shopping actions:
exercises.explanation: Matching shopping action verbs.

exercises.question: Match quality terms:
exercises.explanation: Matching product quality terms.

exercises.question: Match account types:
exercises.explanation: Matching financial terms.

exercises.question: Order the shopping process: 1) Pay 2) Choose items 3) Go to checkout 4) Take receipt
exercises.explanation: The correct shopping sequence.

exercises.question: Order the return process: 1) Get refund 2) Show receipt 3) Bring item back 4) Explain problem
exercises.explanation: Steps for returning an item.

exercises.question: Order: I / afford / can't / this / car
exercises.explanation: Proper sentence structure for expressing inability to afford.

exercises.question: Order: save / to / money / need / I
exercises.explanation: Correct word order for expressing need to save.

exercises.question: Order: is / budget / my / tight / very
exercises.explanation: Proper sentence about budget constraints.

exercises.question: Order: quality / has / product / this / excellent
exercises.explanation: Correct structure for describing product quality.

exercises.question: Order: accept / you / cards / credit / do
exercises.explanation: Proper question format about payment.

exercises.question: Order: includes / price / the / tax
exercises.explanation: Correct sentence about tax inclusion.

exercises.question: Order: delivery / free / over / orders / $50 / on
exercises.explanation: Proper structure for delivery offer.

exercises.question: Order: spend / I / much / too / clothes / on
answer: I spend too much on clothes
exercises.explanation: Correct sentence about spending habits.

exercises.question: Order: cashier / the / at / pay / the
exercises.explanation: Proper instruction for payment location.

exercises.question: Order: warranty / year / one / a / comes / it / with
answer: It comes with a one year warranty
exercises.explanation: Correct structure for warranty information.

exercises.question: Order: shopping / online / is / convenient / very
exercises.explanation: Proper sentence about online shopping.

exercises.question: Correct the error: I need get a refund.
answer: I need to get a refund.
exercises.explanation: Need is followed by 'to' before a verb.

exercises.question: Correct the error: My budget is very tightly.
exercises.explanation: Use adjective 'tight' not adverb 'tightly' after 'is'.

exercises.question: Correct the error: I have many expenses high.
exercises.explanation: Adjective 'high' comes before noun 'expenses'.

exercises.question: Correct the error: I opened a saving account.
exercises.explanation: Use plural 'savings' for savings account.

exercises.question: Correct the error: What is the cost of it?
answer: What is the cost of it?
exercises.explanation: This sentence is actually correct, or use 'How much does it cost?'

exercises.question: Correct the error: The cashier is very friend.
exercises.explanation: Use adjective 'friendly' not noun 'friend'.

exercises.question: Correct the error: This product has quality excellent.
exercises.explanation: Adjective 'excellent' comes before noun 'quality'.

exercises.question: Correct the error: It comes with warranty of one year.
answer: It comes with a one-year warranty.
exercises.explanation: Use article 'a' and hyphenated 'one-year' before warranty.

exercises.question: Correct the error: How much is the total cost?
answer: How much is the total cost?
exercises.explanation: This sentence is correct, or simplify to 'What's the total?'

exercises.question: Correct the error: Tax is include in the price.
answer: Tax is included in the price.
exercises.explanation: Use past participle 'included' with 'is'.

exercises.question: Correct the error: I need some coin for parking.
answer: I need some coins for parking.
exercises.explanation: Use plural 'coins' with 'some'.

exercises.question: Correct the error: Can you break this bills?
exercises.explanation: Use singular 'bill' with 'this'.

exercises.question: Correct the error: I prefer use debit card.
answer: I prefer to use a debit card.
I prefer using a debit card.
exercises.explanation: Prefer is followed by 'to + verb' or 'verb+ing'.

exercises.question: Correct the error: The store open at 9 AM.
exercises.explanation: Add 's' to verb for third person singular.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: '_____ a refund' (get/make/do)
exercises.explanation: We 'get a refund', not make or do.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: 'tight _____' (money/budget/cost)
exercises.explanation: 'Tight budget' is the common collocation.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: 'reduce _____' (expenses/receipts/discounts)
exercises.explanation: We commonly say 'reduce expenses'.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: '_____ account' (savings/expense/payment)
exercises.explanation: 'Savings account' is the correct term.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: 'make a _____' (purchase/receipt/discount)
exercises.explanation: 'Make a purchase' means to buy something.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: 'high _____' (quality/receipt/change)
exercises.explanation: 'High quality' describes excellent products.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: 'under _____' (warranty/price/sale)
exercises.explanation: 'Under warranty' means covered by guarantee.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: 'total _____' (cost/receipt/wallet)
exercises.explanation: 'Total cost' refers to complete price.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: '_____ method' (payment/money/cash)
exercises.explanation: 'Payment method' describes how you pay.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: 'sales _____' (tax/money/coin)
exercises.explanation: 'Sales tax' is tax on purchases.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: '_____ money' (save/receipt/discount)
exercises.explanation: 'Save money' means to keep money for later.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: 'free _____' (delivery/payment/budget)
exercises.explanation: 'Free delivery' means no shipping cost.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: '_____ sale' (clearance/expensive/cheap)
exercises.explanation: 'Clearance sale' is for clearing old stock.

exercises.question: Match the correct collocation: 'price _____' (tag/money/coin)
exercises.explanation: 'Price tag' shows the cost on items.

exercises.question: Which pair rhymes? A) receipt - deceit B) wallet - ballet C) budget - midget
exercises.explanation: Receipt /rɪˈsiːt/ and deceit /dɪˈsiːt/ rhyme with the 'eet' sound.

exercises.question: Which has the same vowel sound as 'cheap'? A) change B) price C) receipt
exercises.explanation: Both 'cheap' /tʃiːp/ and 'receipt' /rɪˈsiːt/ have the long 'ee' sound.

exercises.question: Which word has stress on the first syllable? A) refund B) expense C) budget
exercises.explanation: 'Budget' /ˈbʌdʒɪt/ is stressed on the first syllable.

exercises.question: Which has the same vowel sound as 'cost'? A) store B) coin C) cart
exercises.explanation: 'Cost' /kɔːst/ and 'store' /stɔːr/ have the same 'aw' sound.

exercises.question: Which word has two syllables? A) cash B) money C) coin
exercises.explanation: 'Money' /ˈmʌni/ has two syllables: mon-ey.

exercises.question: Which has stress on the second syllable? A) warranty B) delivery C) cashier
exercises.explanation: 'Cashier' /kæˈʃɪr/ has stress on the second syllable.

exercises.question: Which has the same starting sound as 'save'? A) shopping B) change C) sale
exercises.explanation: 'Save' /seɪv/ and 'sale' /seɪl/ both start with 's' sound.

exercises.question: Which has a silent letter? A) receipt B) refund C) return
exercises.explanation: 'Receipt' has a silent 'p' - pronounced /rɪˈsiːt/.

exercises.question: Which word rhymes with 'bill'? A) sell B) till C) ball
exercises.explanation: 'Bill' /bɪl/ and 'till' /tɪl/ rhyme with short 'i' sound.

exercises.question: Which has the 'aw' sound like 'bought'? A) total B) quality C) affordable
exercises.explanation: 'Affordable' /əˈfɔːrdəbl/ has the 'aw' sound in the middle.

exercises.question: Which has three syllables? A) payment B) customer C) expensive
exercises.explanation: 'Expensive' /ɪkˈspensɪv/ has three syllables: ex-pen-sive.
